key_points: Rickie Fowler watched the Masters broadcast with Tiger Woods at Woods' home on Jupiter Island.
This was Fowler's first time seeing Woods since Woods' car crash in February.
Fowler and Woods discussed their disappointment in not being able to play at the Masters this year.
Woods has won five times at Augusta National, and Fowler has five top-12 finishes in the Masters.
Fowler mentioned that he and Woods analyzed the course's condition during the Masters.
Other Tour pros, including Justin Thomas and Rory McIlroy, have visited Woods and were encouraged by his condition.
Woods has been seen on crutches and riding in a golf cart, showing recovery progress.
Fowler emphasized Woods' current focus on recovering and being able to be active with his children.
Fowler highlighted the severity of Woods' accident but noted the encouragement from Woods' condition.
Fowler failed to qualify for the Masters for the first time in a decade due to his current World No. 116 ranking.
